text: The Jewish World is a Jewish weekly newspaper founded by Sam S. Clevenson on September 23, 1965, covering the Capital District of New York. It was also published under the names Schenectady Jewish World and Albany Jewish world. In 2008, after Clevenson died, his two children Laurie and James continued to publish the newspaper. == References == Page one of the first edition, September 23, 1965 Category:Publications established in 1965 Category:Jewish newspapers published in the United States Category:Jewish-American history Category:Jews and Judaism in New York (state) Category:Weekly newspapers published in the United States Category:1965 establishments in New York (state) Category:Newspapers published in Albany, New York
title: The Jewish World
